title: Real-World Use Cases
description: Discover how WSXJS empowers developers to build powerful applications across various domains. Each use case demonstrates practical applications and explains why WSXJS is the perfect choice.

editorjs.title: EditorJS Plugin Development
editorjs.description: WSXJS was originally created to solve the pain of writing EditorJS block and inline tools. Building custom EditorJS plugins with vanilla JavaScript is very hard and not easy. WSXJS makes it simple with modern JSX syntax and Web Components.

why.title: Why EditorJS as a Use Case?
why.reason1: This is the main reason WSXJS was created - writing EditorJS block and inline tools with vanilla JavaScript is very hard and not easy
why.reason2: WSXJS LightComponents work seamlessly in EditorJS's Light DOM environment, solving the complexity
why.reason3: JSX syntax makes plugin development dramatically simpler and more maintainable than vanilla JavaScript
why.reason4: Type safety and modern tooling transform the difficult EditorJS plugin development experience

features.title: Key Features
features.feature1: Custom block tools (Alert, Code, Table) built with WSX components
features.feature3: Full TypeScript support with proper EditorJS type definitions

marked.title: Marked Custom Renderer
marked.description: Override marked's default renderer with WSX components to create custom, interactive Markdown rendering. Transform plain HTML strings into rich, component-based output.

why.title: Why Marked Custom Renderer as a Use Case?
why.reason1: Traditional marked renderers return HTML strings, making customization and interactivity difficult
why.reason2: WSX components allow you to create custom renderers that return interactive Web Components instead of static HTML
why.reason3: JSX syntax makes renderer methods much cleaner and more maintainable than string concatenation
why.reason4: Type safety and component reusability transform the Markdown rendering experience

features.title: Key Features
features.feature1: Custom renderer methods that return WSX components for headings, code blocks, and more
features.feature2: Interactive Markdown elements with event handlers and reactive state
features.feature3: Component-based rendering with automatic style isolation and reusability

cms.title: Content Management Systems
cms.description: Build flexible CMS interfaces with dynamic content editing, preview, and publishing workflows using WSXJS components.

why.title: Why CMS as a Use Case?
why.reason1: CMS requires reusable, composable components for content blocks
why.reason2: Web Components provide perfect isolation for different content types
why.reason3: LightComponents allow easy theming and styling from parent pages

features.title: Key Features
features.feature1: Modular content blocks as independent Web Components
features.feature2: Dynamic content rendering with reactive state management
features.feature3: Easy integration with existing CMS frameworks and APIs

formBuilder.title: Dynamic Form Builders
formBuilder.description: Create drag-and-drop form builders with real-time validation, conditional logic, and custom field types using WSXJS.

why.title: Why Form Builder as a Use Case?
why.reason1: Forms need reusable field components with consistent behavior
why.reason2: Reactive state management handles complex form validation and dependencies
why.reason3: Web Components ensure form fields work across different frameworks

features.title: Key Features
features.feature1: Custom form field components with built-in validation
features.feature2: Reactive form state management with @state decorator
features.feature3: Framework-agnostic form components for maximum compatibility

dashboard.title: Data Dashboards
dashboard.description: Build interactive dashboards with charts, widgets, and real-time data updates using WSXJS reactive components.

why.title: Why Dashboard as a Use Case?
why.reason1: Dashboards require multiple independent widgets that update independently
why.reason2: Reactive state management handles real-time data updates efficiently
why.reason3: Web Components provide perfect encapsulation for dashboard widgets

features.title: Key Features
features.feature1: Independent widget components with isolated state
features.feature2: Real-time data binding with automatic re-rendering
features.feature3: Easy widget composition and layout management

ecommerce.title: E-commerce Applications
ecommerce.description: Build e-commerce sites with product catalogs, shopping carts, and checkout flows using WSXJS components.

why.title: Why E-commerce as a Use Case?
why.reason1: E-commerce needs reusable product components across different pages
why.reason2: Shopping cart state management benefits from reactive updates
why.reason3: Web Components ensure consistent UI across different parts of the application

features.title: Key Features
features.feature1: Product card components with reactive pricing and inventory
features.feature2: Shopping cart with real-time updates and calculations
features.feature3: Checkout flow with form validation and payment integration

designSystem.title: Design System Components
designSystem.description: Create comprehensive design systems with reusable UI components that work across different frameworks and applications.

why.title: Why Design System as a Use Case?
why.reason2: Web Components provide perfect encapsulation and reusability
why.reason3: JSX syntax makes component development more intuitive than template strings

features.title: Key Features
features.feature1: Reusable component library with consistent API
features.feature2: Theme support with CSS custom properties
